definition: Tang poetry/a Tang poem
to exaggerate/empty/in vain/old variant of 螗[tang2]
Tang dynasty (618-907)/surname Tang
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
poem/CL:首[shou3]/poetry/verse
Three Hundred Tang Poems, an anthology collected around 1763 by Sun Zhu 孫誅

sentences.english: We talk about Tang, there is a kind of tooth Buccal Health fragrant feeling.
sentences.chinese: 我们提起唐诗，就有一种齿颊生香的感觉。

sentences.english: As far as the writing technique is concerned, the Tang poetry combined realism and romanticism.
sentences.chinese: 唐诗在创作方法上，现实主义与浪漫主义并举。

sentences.english: Culture is in central position to Tang Poetry translation.
sentences.chinese: 质言之，文化是考察诗歌意蕴和英译唐诗的核心。

sentences.english: The Chinese parasol image contains plentiful love meanings in Tang Poetry.
sentences.chinese: 唐诗中梧桐意象蕴含着丰富的爱情意义。

sentences.english: It has been China's outstanding literary heritage and the world's literary treasures.
sentences.chinese: 唐诗是中国优秀文学遗产之一，是世界文学瑰宝。

sentences.english: In addition, Tao Yuanming's poetry also has an impact on this school.
sentences.chinese: 此外，苏词还以唐诗为中介接受了陶诗的影响。

sentences.english: In artistic style, Tang poetry is majestic, and Song poetry is graceful and restrained.
sentences.chinese: 三是艺术风格不同，唐诗雄浑，而宋诗婉丽。

sentences.english: Moreover, it is the most widespread and best-known anthology of T'ang poems in the English-speaking world.
sentences.chinese: 同样，在英语世界里传播范围最广的唐诗选本也是它。

sentences.english: Tang poetry, for example, rhymes and sounds much better when read in Cantonese than in Mandarin.
sentences.chinese: 比如唐诗用粤语读起来押韵和发音都比普通话好。

sentences.english: Verse of the Tang Dynasty is the summit in Chinese literature and poetic craft.
sentences.chinese: 唐诗是中国文学的一个高峰，是诗歌艺术的峻岭。

sentences.english: His poems are considered to be" A great reform to Tang Poetry".
sentences.chinese: 他的诗歌被后人评价为“唐诗之一大变”。

sentences.english: The video of Arabella's recitation has gone viral on the Chinese social media.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉贝拉背诵唐诗的视频在中国社交媒体上走红。

sentences.english: Finally in the legendary history of the Tang Dynasty poems and the development of comparison.
sentences.chinese: 最后把传奇中的诗与唐诗史的发展进行比较。

sentences.english: I can recite many Tang poems by heart.
sentences.chinese: 我把唐诗背得滚瓜烂熟。

sentences.english: The famous poet Yuan Haowen in Jin kingdom thinks highly of poet Bai Juyi of the middle Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 金源著名诗人元好问对中唐诗人白居易颇为推崇。

definition: old verse/Classical Chinese poem
Three Hundred Tang Poems, an anthology collected around 1763 by Sun Zhu 孫誅
Yuan dynasty theater, including poetry, music and comedy
famous piece of writing
old language/the Classics/Classical Chinese as a literary model, esp. in Tang and Song prose/Classical Chinese as a school subject
Chu Ci, the Songs of Chu (ancient book of poems, collected during Han but esp. from country of Chu c. 500 BC)
abbr. for Shijing 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], the Book of Songs
poem/CL:首[shou3]/poetry/verse
poetic form consisting of four lines of five syllables, with rhymes on first, second and fourth line
Song of the Pipa Player, long poem by Tang poet Bai Juyi 白居易[Bai2 Ju1 yi4]
yuefu (Chinese style of lyric poetry)
Zhang Ruoxu (c. 660-720), Tang dynasty poet, author of yuefu poem River on a spring night 春江花月夜
Shijing, the Book of Songs, early collection of Chinese poems and one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1]
Wang Wei (701-761), Tang Dynasty poet
Li Shangyin (c. 813-858), Tang poet
verse/CL:行[hang2]
Thousand Character Classic, 6th century poem used as a traditional reading primer
